name: Eamonn O'Neill
content: Eamonn O'Neill - the University of Bath's research portal View Scopus Profile Eamonn O'Neill Prof Head of Department, Department of Computer ScienceUKRI CDT in Accountable, Responsible and Transparent AICentre for the Analysis of Motion, Entertainment Research & ApplicationsCentre for Networks and Collective BehaviourCentre for Doctoral Training in Decarbonisation of the Built Environment (dCarb)REal and Virtual Environments Augmentation Labs (REVEAL)Bath Institute for the Augmented HumanHuman-Computer Interaction https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1637-458X Phone+44 (0) 1225 383216EmailE.ONeillbath.acuk 1 WEST 4.57 Personal profile Research interestsMy main research interests are in developing, evaluating and understanding innovative forms of human-technology interaction and technology-mediated human-human interaction. Topics include mixed, augmented and virtual reality, and interaction with intelligent machines and software. My research has the overarching goal of contributing to an applied science of interactive systems. This involves deriving design principles for the development of such systems that are theoretically well-founded, empirically tested and operationalised for people’s use. This research covers the spectrum of technological, cognitive and social challenges and opportunities that these systems offer. Fingerprint Dive into the research topics where Eamonn O'Neill is active. These topic labels come from the works of this person.
